item.name: Available Real Memory
item.description: Real Memory Available OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.6 The amount of real/physical memory currently unused or available. http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Available Swap Memory
item.description: Real Memory Available OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.4 The amount of swap space currently unused or available. http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Buffered Memory
item.description: Shared Memory OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.14 The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as memory buffers. http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Cached Memory
item.description: Shared Memory OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.15 The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as cached memory. http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Minimum Swap Memory
item.description: OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.12 The minimum amount of swap space expected to be kept free or available during normal operation of this host. If this value (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)') falls below the specified level, then 'memSwapError(100)' will be set to 1 and an error message made available via 'memSwapErrorMsg(101)'. http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Shared Memory
item.description: Shared Memory OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.13 The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as shared memory. http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Swap Error
item.description: OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.100 Indicates whether the amount of available swap space (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)'), is less than the desired minimum (specified by 'memMinimumSwap(12)'). http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

trigger.name: Swap Error on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Indicates whether the amount of available swap space (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)'), is less than the desired minimum (specified by 'memMinimumSwap(12)').

item.name: Swap Error Message
item.description: OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.101 Describes whether the amount of available swap space (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)'), is less than the desired minimum (specified by 'memMinimumSwap(12)'). http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Total Memory Free
item.description: Available Swap Available OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.11 The total amount of memory free or available for use on this host. This value typically covers both real memory and swap space or virtual memory. http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Total Real Memory
item.description: Total Memory Available OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.5 The total amount of real/physical memory allocated for text pages on this host. http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Total Swap Memory
item.description: Total Memory Available OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.3 The total amount of swap space configured for this host. http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Arc C
item.description: Arc C ?

item.name: Arc data
item.description: Arc data

item.name: Arc Cache hit ratio
item.description: Arc hit ratio

item.name: Arc hits
item.description: Arc hits

item.name: Arc meta
item.description: Arc meta ?

item.name: Arc misses
item.description: Arc misses

item.name: Arc Cache miss percent
item.description: Arc cach miss percentage

item.name: Arc Cache miss ratio
item.description: Arc cach miss ratio

item.name: Arc P
item.description: Arc P ?

item.name: Arc size
item.description: Arc size iin bytes

item.name: L2Arc hits
item.description: L2Arc hits

item.name: L2Arc misses
item.description: L2Arc misses

item.name: L2Arc size
item.description: L2Arc size iin bytes

item.name: ZIL operations per second
item.description: ZIL operations per second

discovery_rule.name: Datasets
discovery_rule.description: Discover the datasets available on the FreeNAS system

item_prototype.name: Available bytes on dataset {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The available bytes of each dataset. This is multiplied by the datasetAllocationUnits which is usually 4096. The OID for this is .1.3.6.1.4.1.50536.1.2.1.1.3

item_prototype.name: Usage of dataset {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Used percentage of the datasets capacity

trigger_prototype.name: Dataset {#SNMPVALUE} usage is over 70%
trigger_prototype.description: Your dataset is starting to get full. You might want to increase it's quota or increase the disk space.

item_prototype.name: Used bytes on dataset {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The used bytes in each dataset. This is multiplied by the datasetAllocationUnits which is usually 4096. The OID for this is .1.3.6.1.4.1.50536.1.2.1.1.3

item_prototype.name: Size of dataset {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The size of each dataset. This is multiplied by the datasetAllocationUnits which is usually 4096. The OID for this is .1.3.6.1.4.1.50536.1.2.1.1.3

item_prototype.name: Read bandwidth on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The bandwidth of all read operations (including metadata), expressed as units per second (over 1 second interval)

item_prototype.name: Total read bandwidth on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The bandwidth of all read operations (including metadata), expressed as units per second (averaged since system booted)

item_prototype.name: Write bandwidth on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The bandwidth of all write operations, expressed as units per second (over 1 second interval).

item_prototype.name: Total write bandwidth on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The bandwidth of all write operations, expressed as units per second (averaged since system booted).

item_prototype.name: Total IO Read Ops on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of read I/O operations sent to the pool or device, including metadata requests (averaged since system booted).

item_prototype.name: IO Read Ops on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of read I/O operations sent to the pool or device, including metadata requests (over 1 second interval).

item_prototype.name: Total IO Write Ops on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of write I/O operations sent to the pool or device (averaged since system booted).

item_prototype.name: IO Write Ops on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of write I/O operations sent to the pool or device (over 1 second interval).

item_prototype.name: Available bytes on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of available bytes on the pool. This is multiplied by the datasetAllocationUnits which is usually 4096. The OID for this is .1.3.6.1.4.1.50536.1.2.1.1.3

item_prototype.name: Usage of pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Used percentage of the pools capacity

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} usage is over 80%
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is more than 80% full! It is a known fact that performance will degrade significantly. Please free up some space.

item_prototype.name: Size of pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The size of the pool expressed as bytes

item_prototype.name: Used bytes on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of used bytes in the pool.

item_prototype.name: Health of pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The current health of the containing pool, as reported by zpool status. online(0), degraded(1), faulted(2), offline(3), unavail(4), removed(5)

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is DEGRADED!
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in degraded state. online(0), degraded(1), faulted(2), offline(3), unavail(4), removed(5)

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is FAULTED!
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in faulted state. You are in trouble

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in OFFLINE state
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in offline state. Maybe your pool is locked?

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in REMOVED state
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in removed state.

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in UNAVAILABLE state
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in unavailable state.

item_prototype.name: Name of pool #$1
item_prototype.description: The name of the ZFS Pool

discovery_rule.name: ZVols
discovery_rule.description: Find all the zvols on the FreeNAS system

item_prototype.name: Available bytes on zvol {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The available bytes of each zvol. This is multiplied by the datasetAllocationUnits which is usually 4096. The OID for this is .1.3.6.1.4.1.50536.1.2.1.1.3

item_prototype.name: Usage of zvol {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Used percentage of the zvols capacity

trigger_prototype.name: Zvol {#SNMPVALUE} usage is over 70%
trigger_prototype.description: The zvol is getting full, you may want to increase its space.

item_prototype.name: Size of zvol {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The size of each zvol. This is multiplied by the datasetAllocationUnits which is usually 4096. The OID for this is .1.3.6.1.4.1.50536.1.2.1.1.3

item_prototype.name: Used bytes on zvol {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The used bytes in each zvol. This is multiplied by the datasetAllocationUnits which is usually 4096. The OID for this is .1.3.6.1.4.1.50536.1.2.1.1.3

item.name: Device contact details
item.description: The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device description
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Device location
item.description: The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device name
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device uptime
item.description: The time since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: Number of network interfaces
item.description: The number of network interfaces (regardless of their current state) present on this system.

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description: You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs. {$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Admin status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Description of interface $1
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware/software.

item_prototype.name: Inbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Incoming traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Operational status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE}

item_prototype.name: Outbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that could not be transmitted because of errors.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Utilization of processor #$1
item_prototype.description: The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.
